poem:
### Other Lands

Morning spin of headlines,  
the West Bank—a needle  
stitching stories with threadbare hope.  
Cameras unearth tales  
where fences tear the fabric of days,  
while eyes on different sides  
meet in the arc of captured light,  
reminding us, perhaps,  
of lands beyond borders,  
where the lens remembers  
more than earth can hold.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "No Other Land review – stark, unflinching West Bank documentary If anything can be described as essential viewing, it’s this stark and unflinching account of life on the ground in a contested region of the West Bank. Directed by a collective of Palestinian and Israeli film-makers and journalists – Basel Adra, Hamdan Ballal, Yuval Abraham and Rachel Szor – No Other Land won best documentary at the Berlin film festival in a ceremony that subsequently". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
